title: Preview - Gameday
custom_preconds:
Given there is a game in Preview
and the user access Gameday
custom_steps: When the user taps the Preview link from the scoreboard or Team Page
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the Game Preview view and they can see the team logos, game time, stadium and other relevant info appear correctly

title: Live - Gameday
custom_preconds:
Given there is a Live Game 
and the user accesses Gameday

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game goes into Warmup state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the correct state appear on the scoreboard page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When pitch by pitch is available
AND the user taps the Gameday button in the scoreboard or team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then they should be taken to the Gameday tab of the Gameday view (If team has Gameday button)
And Pitcher and Batter's names should appear correctly and be clearly readable

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the game is in Warmup state
AND the user taps the gameday button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the correct batter and pitcher are shown

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in Warmup state
AND they click on gameday from scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then they are taken to the Gameday view where The Gameday (if available for team), Field, Box Score and Summary tabs are all active and tapable
And tapping on each tab takes the user to the correct view
But none of the tabs have any game data recorded yet.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game goes into a live state
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the game go into a live state on the scoreboard
And the gameday button should appear
And in the gameday view the game should appear as live with all tabs accessible(Gameday button only appears for some teams)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is in Gameday
and viewing the Pitch-by-Pitch View for a live game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the premium billboard with the text MiLB.TV

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on Gameday Tab of the Gameday view (If game has Gameday tab available)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the player's names should appear correctly and be readable

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a game with pitch by pitch available
And the user is in the Gameday tab view of Gameday
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the info in this tab should refresh automatically

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in progress and updating
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the pitch counts appearing correctly on the scoreboard and in the Gameday view.

custom_steps_separated.content: When players are occupying the bases
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then this should be accurately reflected on:

1) The Scoreboard page:
a)On the bases in the game cell
b)On the bases in the expanded drawer

2) In the Gameday view(If Gameday button exists for team):
a) On the bases in the Scoreboard

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is ongoing
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the innings should be updating correctly across all tabs

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is put into a delayed start state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the scoreboard will show the delay but the Gameday Preview icon will still appear on the scoreboard and the use will not be able to access Gameday or other tabs

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in progress and any half inning has been completed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the half inning should be reflected on the scoreboard, it should show "Mid" as well as "End" of innings

custom_steps_separated.content: When any hit appears, (Single, Double Triple, etc)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it should appear correctly in the pitch by pitch in the bottom half of the window

custom_steps_separated.content: When a stolen base occurs or is entered
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Stolen base should update correctly and be reflected in the pitch by pitch, the play should also be reflected on the basepad indicator

custom_steps_separated.content: When a pitch appears
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the color of the pitch should be correctly reflected (Strikes - Red, Balls - Green, In Play - Blue)
*Only some classes will display pitch by pitch

custom_steps_separated.content: When a batter appears in the view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the batter should appear on the appropriate side of the plate based on their hitting preference

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is updating
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the pitches should display correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the batter changes
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the new batter should update correctly and their batting preference should be reflected correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Box Score tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they should be taken to the Box Score Tab and Player names should appear clearly and be readable

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Box Score tab in the Gameday view
And there is a game in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Tab should update live according to fetch settings with correct Inning, Score and Batter

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Boxscore tab taps the Home and Away tabs at the top of the page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the lineups should switch for the appropriate team, tapping back and forth should not cause any issues

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Boxscore tab attempts to scroll the linescore at the top of the page on an extra innings game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the innings should scroll without a problem, the user should be able to see all the innings without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Boxscore tab of the Gameday view and a user taps a player name
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Player card should be opened

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user navigates to to the scoreboard and taps on the gameday icon of an active game and taps on the boxscore tab on the bottom nav
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the home team listed underneath the away team in the linescore at the top

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user navigates to Gameday of an active game and taps the boxscore tab in the bottom nav and uses the stringer to simulate a HR with the 1st batter of the game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following stats updated in the box score:

AB 1
R 1
H 1
RBI 1
BB 0
SO 0
LOB 0
AVG (this will be the whatever the player's season average is)

And underneath the batters in the Batting section will see HR section updated

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user navigates to Gameday and taps on the boxscore tab and uses the stringer to simulate a walk (BB) with the 1st batter of the game and uses the stringer to simulate a stolen base (SB)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the box score update:

AB 0
R 0
H 0 
RBI 0
BB 1
SO 0
LOB 0
AVG .000

And below the stats in the base running section the SB section will be updated with the baserunner

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user navigates to Gameday and taps on the boxscore tab and uses the stringer to simulate a walk (BB) with the 1st batter of the game and uses the stringer to simulate a caught stealing (CS)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the box score update:

AB 0
R 0
H 0
RBI 0
BB 1
SO 0
LOB 0
AVG .000

And below the stats in the batting section the CS section will be updated with the baserunner

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Field tab in the Gameday view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the stadium name should appear in the top bar, it should appear correctly and be readable

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Field tab in the Gameday view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Field graphic should be visible and accurate

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user Taps the Field button
custom_steps_separated.expected: The Field tab should open

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Field tab in the Gameday view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Player's names should be readable and appear correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is in the Field view
And the game is ongoing
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the Field tab update live according to the fetch settings

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Summary tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be taken to the Summary view, the tab should appear correctly and be selectable

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Summary tab in the Gameday view
And there is a game ongoing
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Summary tab should update live about every 15 seconds

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Summary tab
AND a play occurs
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the plays update accurately and be readable

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Gameday view and taps the Summary tab and taps an inning on the right side of the screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the view shift to the Summary for that inning

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Gameday view and taps the Summary tab and taps an inning on the right side of the screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the appropriate view should appear

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Gameday view and taps the Summary tab and an inning change occurs

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will see that the player pictures will quickly show a default before loading the correct players picture

custom_steps_separated.content: When an inning change occurs

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is a game that is delayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game appears at the top of the list with all other in progress games

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in Delayed state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all tabs within gameday are clickable and are no longer updating with post delay data

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then that state is indicated on the scoreboard and within the Gameday view

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is put into any type of delay, Rain, Snow, Ceremony, etc

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is a game that is postponed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game should appear as postponed on the scoreboard and in the Gameday tab

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is put into any type of postponement, Rain, Snow, Tragedy, etc
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then if should reflect the Postponed state without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is a game that is postponed

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is a game that is suspended
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game should appear as suspended on the scoreboard and in all the Gameday tabs

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is put into any type of suspension, Rain, Snow, Tragedy, etc
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then if should reflect the suspended state without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: When game is in Suspended state

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps any of the tabs on the bottom navigation
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they should be taken to the tab they selected, all tabs should remain tappable and should have latest data

title: Final - Gameday
custom_preconds:
Given there is a game is in Final state
and the user accesses Gameday

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is a game that has gone final
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game should appear as final on the scoreboard and in all the Gameday tabs, the Gameday Wrap page should appear in place of Gameday tab

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is a game that ends before 9 innings (in mid inning or after completion of inning)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game should appear and act as Final game

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it should appear as a Final game on the Scoreboard and on all tabs in Gameday

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it should appear as a Final game and it should be indicated that the game went more than 9 innings, (eg. Final/12)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game has been completed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Verify that the game appears correctly as Final and there are no inconsistencies with other games that have gone final

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game has been completed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game should appear as a Final game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Gameday button or the game info button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they should be directed to the Game Wrap page that has the winning and losing pitchers as well as other relevant game information

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is final and the user taps on Wrap from either Team Page Game Detail or the Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to Wrap of Gameday

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Wrap of a completed games and views the top header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following:
Back button
Away Team Code @ Home Team Code (WSH @ OAK)
Date of the Game (May 16, 2016)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Wrap part of Gameday
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see:

Winning Team:
W:<Pitcher's Last name> (<# of wins that season>-<# of losses that season>, ERA)

Losing Team:
L:<Pitcher's Last name> (<# of wins that season>-<# of losses that season>, ERA)

Save (if applicable)
SV: <Pitcher's Last name> (<# of saves that season>)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Wrap part of Gameday
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see see the team logos, team names, team records, a game state of final, stadium name, box score, and homeruns hit in the game for each team (if applicable)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the wrap part of Gameday
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a Wrap headline, game image, and blurb

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the Wrap
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following information below the wrap blurb and article:
Umpires
Weather
Wind
Start Time

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps any of the tabs on the bottom navigation
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they should be taken to the tab they selected, all tabs should remain tappable and should have latest data even once game goes into Final
